page.title: 01Hills North of Machynlleth
page.content: Hilly country falling from 2000 feet in west to south flowing Dulas river in east of block. Hills are well covered with forest up to 50 years old mostly con iferous. Trees are mainly sitka, spruce but larch, western red cedar, western Remlock a little pine, an douglas fir on better ground have been planed. Scattered remmants of oak forest exist. 2 Narrow strips of virgin wild wood survive in inacessible revines cut by tributary streams. Some broad leaved tree planting has been successful in centre of block. 2 Sheep farms exist, one east of Dulas river has reseeded most pasture. Other farm has started planting conier trees. About 25 houses are lived in (excluding village of Esgairgeilsy) mostly in Dulas valley. Also present are 2 farms, 2 small holdings, 2 holiday homes,
